metadata.Title: CVE-2017-11569 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
FontForge 20161012 is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer over-read in readttfcopyrights (parsettf.c) resulting in DoS or code execution via a crafted otf file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-11569` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fontforge - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
fontforge-common - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
fontforge-nox - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
libfontforge1 - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
libgdraw4 - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
python-fontforge - 20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fontforge package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '20120731.b-7.1ubuntu0.1').
